attributes.action: take immediate steps to amend the Traffic Management Act 2004 to effect the re-naming of "Civil Enforcement Officers" to the more appropriate job-descriptive title: "Parking Attendant".
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Once upon a time we called a spade “a spade” and we all knew what it was, what it looked like and its uses.
 Once upon a time we called Parking Attendants “Parking Attendants” and we knew what their job was. Then they morphed into “Traffic Wardens” although they had nothing to do with traffic, nor were they wardens.
 BUT since the Traffic Management Act 2004 Traffic Wardens have morphed into “Civil Enforcement Officers” – with different uniforms, depending on the local council’s preference,  and a title which in no way relates to their function.  
  WORSE, because they have this over-blown title, some councils are empowering  CEOs to issue fixed penalties for anti-social behaviour, environmental crime and locally enacted ordinances such as noise violations, in addition to parking violations.
 We demand that “Civil Enforcement Officers” are renamed “Traffic Wardens” with a standard nation-wide uniform so that we know who they are and limit them to their primary function.
